alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:46AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Wood and northwestern Hancock Counties through 730 AM EDT... At 645 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Leipsic, or near Ottawa, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bowling Green, North Baltimore, McComb, Van Buren, Bloomdale, Cygnet, Portage, Jerry City, Hoytville, Custar, West Millgrove, Milton Center and Bairdstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
